reviews.text: And so she is an Grand Old Dame. The Hoa Binh is a lovely old girl. My husband loved the sweeping wood staircase taking you up 2 floors, and the quality wood accents in our room added to the feeling of old world charm. The location couldn't of been better for watching the "super crazy" traffic snarls on Christmas Eve, and just 7 blocks from hotel was probably the best restaurant in all of Vietnam (and we ate at a lot of them)! The whole restaurant is full of little kiosks, tiny restaurants in themselves, and everything you order from the menu comes from one of these small places. Wonderfully clean and a place where locals eat, we only wished we had more time to sample more of the dishes. The walk to the restaurant is interesting to say the least, but the area as a whole is pretty safe, and the walk to and around the lake is marvelous. We only wish we could of had more time at the Hoa Binh, but it was a great way to say goodbye to Vietnam!
reviews.title: Loved the Grand Old Dame

likes.liked: — It's Location, it's away from the Old Quarter but close enough to walk there.
likes.disliked: — It allowed smoking in the restuarant. Second hand smoke and breakfast just don't go well together

reviews.text: Order pick up at airport, and that went very smoothly. Rooms are good size, and staff very friendly. Stayed for 2 nights. Breakfast at the top of the hotel with excellent view over the city. Safe in the room and ATM just outside. Rate it average due to high price level compared to other Vietnamese hotels. Didn't stand out, but everything worked. Happy with it.
reviews.title: Nice enough hotel
Hoa Binh Palace hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hoa Binh Palace Hotel in Hanoi's old quarter. What a fantastic experience. We stayed in an executive suite which had been renovated to a high standard. Mr Tran Tuan the MD met us at the airport and drove us back to the hotel. The staff were all extremely friendly and couldnt do enough to help. Fresh fruit in the room everyday and they even provided a birthday cake for my partner.If you are looking for a centrally located hotel right opposite a market then look no further.5* treatment 3* price. The food was great and varied, from the buffet breakfast to dinner.Very clean. The massage was excellent $12US for 80 min full body.

reviews.title: Go for a suite
reviews.text: We originally only booked for two days here as we were going to Halong Bay and thought we'd see what some of the other hotels were like. We had a small room, overlooking a back street and spent a lot of time just leaning on the window ledge watching the goings on in the street below.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a couple of nights there we decided to book a room for when we got back from Halong, but asked if we could upgrade to a suite. For an extra $10US the difference was amazing. It was about three times the size of the other room, the bathroom was much more modern, there was a lot more cupboard space and more places to sit.
reviews.title: Not so great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recommended this hotel by our Vietnamese Tour guide. It has a good location, only 5 mins walk to the lake and is in a (reasonably) quiet part of Hanoi's city centre.
reviews.title: Nice Olden style hotel

likes.liked: — The location and the olden style
likes.disliked: — they charge you a fortune to use the net

reviews.text: I love olden style buildings so was happy to stay here. It is in basic colonial style, but is not elegantly decked out. It has so much potential to be so beautiful.
reviews.title: The wrong way to upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway the beds were comfortable, the staff friendly and the room spacious so we were happy. All hotels in Hanoi seem to be a lot more expensive than other cities in Vietnam, so this one was decent value.
reviews.title: Our First Stop In Vietnam
Stay away!
reviews.text: Vietnam has been reunited but the north and south are still very different places. An excellent illustration is to compare the Majestic in Saigon with the Hoa Binh. Whereas the modernization of the Majestic was done perfectly, Hoa Binh's was perfectly wrong.

This looks like it must have been an elegant hotel at one time. A lot of renovation has been done, yet the place still looks rundown. The improvements have been carried out in a careless, haphazard way. Example: There's a hair dryer in the bathroom. When it got installed, the electrician obviously drilled a hole for the power, but in the wrong place. So he drilled another but tyhe first was never repaired. The hair dryer was connected but not the ground wire, and the wires are just loosely taped together.
reviews.title: Ignore the previous reviews

reviews.text: After reading the other reviews we were a bit concerned about this place.
reviews.title: Would stay here again!!

likes.liked: — Built in 1926! Just out of the main mad rush hub part of town but close enough when needed.
likes.disliked: — Old style keys so had to remember to lock your door!

reviews.title: Governement-owned hotel. Small, musty, smelly rooms. Indifferent service.
reviews.text: We booked Deluxe rooms for $78/night incl Breakfast. The rooms were very clean, no smells!, bathroom was fine, TV, mini bar etc etc..and a balcony!!

The ambience of the hotel was as you would expect from a old colonial past. Similar feel to the Peace Hotel in Shanghai, but of course not on the same scale. Beautuful grand wooden staircase that I had to walk up and down each day - sod the lift!
reviews.title: Unfulfilled potential
had to check out
reviews.text: I was booked at this hotel because of my work in Vietnam. I would not have chosen it otherwise.

reviews.title: One step up from backpacking
reviews.text: The industrial/medical smell hit me like a brick wall when I entered my room. I stayed the first night with much discomfort and asked for a different room. The room they offered me had the same smell, so I checked out because they had no other room except a suite at about $150/night. To be fair, there were those in my group who had no problem with their rooms.

likes.disliked: — Hot corridors in summer - street noise reaches front rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you need internet access, there is only one computer in the lobby for all guests, tho there is access by wire in rooms. It is not wireless. There is no business center.

Very bad service, and we ended up missing flight!!!
reviews.text: The hotel is in a very busy part of the Old Quarter; the market is across the street, and it is a short walk to the Lake. However, pickpockets abound in this part of town.
